That's a great idea! Getting multiple quotes from different plumbers will help you compare prices and services.

And absolutely, it's a good idea to ask the plumbers about checking the rest of the pipes in the bathroom while they're fixing the leaky faucet. This is a great opportunity to get a more comprehensive assessment of your bathroom's plumbing system.

Here are some questions you can ask the plumbers:

* "While you're fixing the leaky faucet, can you also inspect the rest of the pipes in the bathroom to ensure there aren't any other leaks or issues?"
* "Would you recommend a camera inspection of the pipes to check for any hidden leaks or damage?"
* "Are there any other potential issues you commonly see in bathrooms that I should be aware of?"
* "Can you provide a comprehensive quote for fixing the leaky faucet and any other repairs or maintenance you recommend for the bathroom plumbing system?"

By asking these questions, you'll get a better understanding of the plumber's approach and whether they're willing to go the extra mile to ensure your bathroom's plumbing system is in good condition.

Additionally, this can also help you identify any potential issues before they become major problems, which can save you money and headaches in the long run.

Remember to also ask about any additional costs or fees associated with the inspection or repairs, so you can factor that into your decision-making process.
